thread.title: Manchester United transfer news: Luke Shaw 'bemused' by Jose Mourinho treatment | Metro News
thread.title_full: Manchester United transfer news: Luke Shaw 'bemused' by Jose Mourinho treatment | Metro News

author: Sean Kearns For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Manchester United transfer news: Luke Shaw 'bemused' by Jose Mourinho treatment | Metro News
text:
Sean Kearns for Metro.co.uk Thursday 23 Feb 2017 12:28 pm Luke Shaw could leave Manchester United this summer (Picture: Getty) 
Manchester United defender Luke Shaw is said to be ‘bemused’ by Jose Mourinho’s treatment of him at Old Trafford and could seek to leave the club this summer. 
The 21-year-old has played just once in the last three months and has been left out completely from Manchester United’s last three matchday squads. Keep smiling! Mourinho of all people melts hearts with touching message to Ranieri 
The left-back sustained a career-threatening double leg break last season but he’s been in full training with Mourinho’s squad over the last few months. 
United have a congested fixture list but the likes of Daley Blind, Ashley Young and Matteo Darmian have all been favoured in wide areas. Shaw’s made just 14 appearances this term (Picture: Getty) 
Mourinho insisted last week that he wanted to keep Shaw this summer but, according to the Guardian , the defender could look to leave at the end of the season for first team football. 
The England international is thought to be ‘bemused’ by the treatment he’s received from the United boss and can’t see why he hasn’t been used in recent FA Cup and Europa League fixtures. 
Understandably, Shaw is desperate for action after spending 12 months on the sidelines but he’s been reduced to just 14 appearances this term – only one of which has come in 2017.
